chemical_compound: difunctional aziridine amide derived from isophthalic acid and propylene imine
physical_form: colorless to yellow viscous liquid or whitish solid melting near 35 °C

equivalent_weight.description: Overall equivalent weight for reactive aziridine functionality (KCNS titration).
equivalent_weight.determination_method: KCNS titration (per 3M Dynamar HX-752 product bulletin)
equivalent_weight.notes: Use this equivalent weight to determine stoichiometric ratios when HX-752 is used as a curative, chain extender, or bonding agent in polyurethane or carboxyl-functional systems.

recommended_usage.role_in_propellant: bonding agent / curative for AP in polybutadiene matrices
mixing_notes: Typically used at low levels as a bonding agent for AP in HTPB or PB matrices.
Does not generate ammonia, so it does not cause foaming the way HX-878 can.
Material tends to supercool and crystallize; may need warming to ~45 °C to re-liquefy before use.

other_references.description: 3M Dynamar HX-752 product bulletin (difunctional aziridine amide bonding agent / curative)

safety.hazards_summary: Difunctional aziridine amide; may be corrosive and can polymerize exothermically if overheated. Avoid skin and eye contact, inhalation of vapors, and prolonged exposure.
recommended_ppe: suitable respirator if vapors may be present
special_hazards: hazardous polymerization may occur if a mass of product is heated above approximately 55 °C
exothermic behavior observed near 190 °C with ~121 cal/g heat release in DSC tests

conditions: recommended storage at approximately -18 °C (0 °F) for long-term stability
avoid repeated warm-cool cycles; repack into batch-sized containers if partial lots are used
protect from moisture and excessive heat
storage.shelf_life_notes: At -18 °C, typical shelf life is at least one year. At higher temperatures, HX-752 will slowly homopolymerize or rearrange to the oxazoline form.

notes: Acts as a bonding agent for ammonium perchlorate in polybutadiene matrices and can also serve as a chain extender or crosslinker for carboxyl-functional or hydroxyl-functional polymers in the presence of acidic species.
Requires refrigeration and careful handling because of its tendency to supercool and its potential for hazardous polymerization at elevated temperatures.
